page.title: 10EAST LODGE LITTLE OFFLEY
page.content: Nine chickens are kept in the yard,fed from the small amount of grain escaping from the sacks carried on the lorries.He keeps several ducks for their eggs, and two dogs to guard the house and land. The house was originally two cottages, joined together in 1968,by the removal of a wall.The workshop was constructed in 1981.The following year the house was damaged by lightning.It is centrally heated,with four bedrooms all modern conveniences e.g.'phone, television,and stereo.The family do any shopping in Hitchin but do not use the limited sports facilities in the area.They do not go to church but occasionally use the local 'pub'. This is an example of family using all available resources in a fairly rural area,with very few amenities.
